toc_entry.title: Isle Without End
toc_entry.description: An early castaway described Padre Island as “a wretched, barren sandbank.” It’s better known today as the Gold Coast of Texas, but its identity is still rooted in wildness and age-old solitude.

toc_entry.title: An Aggie's Revenge
toc_entry.description: Starting with his alma mater and using little more than charm, Robert Hicks conned the college fundraising industry out of hundreds of thousands of dollars. His name is mud at A&M.

toc_entry.title: Operator, Give Me Information
toc_entry.description: It seems practically impossible to choose the best deal from the multitude of services offered by all the new long distance phone companies. But we’ve got their number.

toc_entry.title: The Wee World Of Golf
toc_entry.description: Looking for a sport that offers plenty of cheap thrills and wacky challenges but requires no training, no equipment, and no big bucks? Try miniature golf.

toc_entry.title: The Two-Step
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Forget about waltzing across Texas. Let’s two-step instead.

toc_entry.title: My Three Sons
toc_entry.description: Maybe the mayhem generated by a trio of battling boys is just their idea of brotherly love.

toc_entry.title: Ghost Rider
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Don’t Do What They Did To David Clyde
toc_entry.subtitle: Sports
toc_entry.description: Though he fought against bad management, bad coaching, and bad habits, he finally struck out at baseball, the victim of too much too soon.

toc_entry.title: The Pink People
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: A new recruit to the ranks of Mary Kay beauty consultants struggles valiantly to do his part in reaching the woman of the eighties and keeping the company in the pink.

toc_entry.title: A Concrete Romance
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: One man’s whim-turned-obsession is changing Houston’s McKee Street Bridge and its faded environs into one of the few really original artistic images of the city.

toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Sometimes the opera is over before the fat lady sings. Consider the successful debut of sixteen brief and eclectic works commissioned by the Texas Opera Theater.

toc_entry.description: Prizzi’s Honor is a macabre satire of the two-career marriage; Cocoon can’t burst free of its nice-guy limitations; Pale Rider recycles all the wrong western riffs; St. Elmo’s Fire should have been doused from the start.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Labor’s nuke.

toc_entry.title: Back Roads

toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events.
